channel.title: My server will not allow me to connect to it?
channel.description: I have recently "port-forwarded" on my SKY router and done everything I'm sure I needed to do because it says runenightmare.no-ip.org is online with most server status checkers (I am keeping the server up for you to verify that if you need to.) Though if I try to connect with the source I'm running (Devolution 2.7 by Killamess) with the client (Moparscape 3.2 w/ Aryan) it doesn't work. However obviously, it still lets me connect with Localhost (0.0.0.0)/(127.0.0.1) (It then disconnects me virtually straight away but that's an issue with the client compatability I'm sure and it should therefore do the exact same thing using the No-IP but it doesn't?

item.title: My server will not allow me to connect to it?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

umm if others couldn’t connect maybe the client doesn’t have the right ip or you didn’t portforward right?

Read full topic

item.title: My server will not allow me to connect to it?

item.description:
@The_Unholy wrote:

Kicking I’ve undone the changes I made to my router settings until I can find the issue.

Ultimate, I’m aware of this but they couldn’t connect using my no-ip.

item.title: My server will not allow me to connect to it?

item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

it disconnects you due to the moparscape client’s compatibility maybe find a client for it that works and your suppose to use 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 the other people use your no-ip

item.title: My server will not allow me to connect to it?

@The_Unholy wrote:

I have recently “port-forwarded” on my SKY router and done everything I’m sure I needed to do because it says runenightmare.no-ip.org is online with most server status checkers (I am keeping the server up for you to verify that if you need to.) Though if I try to connect with the source I’m running (Devolution 2.7 by Killamess) with the client (Moparscape 3.2 w/ Aryan) it doesn’t work. However obviously, it still lets me connect with Localhost (0.0.0.0)/(127.0.0.1) (It then disconnects me virtually straight away but that’s an issue with the client compatability I’m sure and it should therefore do the exact same thing using the No-IP but it doesn’t?
